alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 3:19AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO 6 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches. Isolated areas could see up to four inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. The potential for localized snow squalls exists during Friday afternoon, especially along the Interstate 25 corridor. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero from Friday evening through the weekend. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Scotts Bluff County and Morrill County. In Wyoming, Converse County Lower Elevations, East Platte County and Goshen County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM to 5 PM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Friday to 6 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County
